roleset.name: play a role; behave
roleset.note: ACT-V NOTES: Verbnet entry 29.6, other framed members include count and rank. No comparison. Also see "act like". (from act.01-v)

example.name: act-v: typical usage
example.text: First National Bank of Chicago will act as trustee...

example.name: act-v: behave
example.text: Sometimes I would even act a little silly with them.

roleset.name: do something, perform an action
roleset.note: ACT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'act' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. (from act.02-v predicate notes)
ACTION-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry act.02, OntoNotes grouping action-n senses 1 & 4; no relevant mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from action.01-n)

example.name: act-v: with grounds
example.text: Mr. Rifenburgh said the board still hasn't acted on most of the internal report's recommendations...
example.arg: on most of the internal report's recommendations

example.name: act-v: no grounds
example.text: ``They always listened, but they never acted,'' Mr. Guber says.

example.name: action-n: autogen1
example.text: House action on federal catastrophic-illness insurance

example.name: action-n: NP only, all arguments
example.text: a recent action by the heirs of singer Bobby Darin against McDonald 's Corp. over its `` Mac Tonight '' TV commercials , arough parody of Mr. Darin 's `` Mack the Knife '' trademark.
example.arg: by the heirs of singer Bobby Darin
over its "Mac Tonight" TV commercials, a rough parody of Mr. Darin's "Mack the Knife" trademark.

example.name: take_action-l sisters of complex rel annotated
example.text: I-1 was forced *PRO*-1 to take violent action when John tried to steal my donut.
example.arg: when John tried to steal my donut.

example.name: action-n: Arg 0 only
example.text: The village was destroyed by volcanic action.

example.name: action-n: Arg 0 as "of" PP
example.text: The action of natural forces such as pressure and high temperature creates metamorphic rock from igneous or sedimentary rock.
example.arg: of natural forces such as pressure and high temperature

roleset.name: thing done
roleset.note: ACT-N NOTES: Added automatically by Julia. Related to act.xml (from act.04-n)

example.name: act-v
example.text: "I was angry when I saw his violent act against animals."

roleset.name: perform a role
roleset.note: ACT_OUT-V NOTES: Roleset for 'act out' based on instances in Webtext 76-99. No VerbNet entry. Comparison to act.01. Framed by Claire (from act.03-v)

example.name: act_out-v: With role/scenario
example.text: I was so desperate , *PRO*-1 acting out Romeo 's struggle before he stabbed himself with a dagger , calling out in my heart : money , money , money , though what *T*-2 came out of my mouth was Juliet 's name .
example.arg: Romeo's struggle before he stabbed himself with a dagger

roleset.name: cause trouble
roleset.note: Added by Julia based on SMS02.

example.name: act_up-v: intransitive
example.text: Maybe while allergies are acting up

roleset.name: participating in, live, in use
roleset.note: ACTIVE-J NOTES: Based on Sharp data. Slight comparison to move.01 and live.01. Framed by Katie. (from active.01-j)
ACTIVITY-N NOTES: Added automatically by Julia. Related to active.xml (from activity.01-n)
ACTIVENESS-N NOTES: Added by Julia for unification.

example.name: active-j: Use MNR for the way something is active
active-j: use ext for degree
example.text: The malignant cells are highly mitotically acive with over 40 mitoses per 10 high power fields
example.arg: with over 40 mitoses per 10 high power fields

example.name: active-j: both args
example.text: We invite everyone who-1 *-1 is active in the prevention of diabetes and chronic diseases
example.arg: in the prevention of diabetes and chronic diseases

example.name: activity-n
example.text: The doctor was not pleased with his lack of activity.

example.name: activity-n: both args
example.text: He won the prize after earning a chance in the library's weekly drawing based on his reading activity.

example.name: activeness-n
example.text: The young person asked him about his mission of learning a new language, and the secret of his activeness, passion and happiness.
